result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both Operating w/ PAC (3rd) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer] and OWI (3rd) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer]. The defendant was found guilty of Operating w/ PAC (3rd) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer] and the other charge, OWI (3rd) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer] was dismissed by the court.

  • David M Oksa was found guilty of Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).
  • David M Oksa was found guilty of Operating w/ PAC (3rd) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Def to report to the DOC in Ashland within 24 hours after release from Ashland County Jail. 
If def is placed on probation or extended supervision & owes financial obligations ordered by the Court at the time of discharge, a civil judgment may be entered against the def for all unpaid financial obligations.
  While on supervision the Def is to pay their financial obligations thru the Clerk of Court, which may include payments on restitution, fines, costs, surcharges, etc that are court ordered.
The payments are to be paid directly to the Clerk of Court Office at:
Ashland Co Clerk of Circuit Court
201 Main Street West - Room 307
Ashland, WI  54806

miscConds.notes:
Defendant shall not possess/consume alcoholic beverages, illegal drugs, drug paraphernalia or any mind altering substances (MAS).  MAS means alcoholic beverages, controlled substances other than those prescribed by treating physician to the Def & taken only as prescribed, inhalants, synthetic marijuana or a similar substance, and/or over-the-counter medications used contrary to label instructions.  THE DEFENDANT IS TO MAINTAIN ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
The Defendant shall not enter any bars, taverns, liquor stores (any place where the primary purpose is the sale of alcohol) where mind altering substances are present, consumed or sold..
  The Def is subject to random UA testing.
Undergo alcohol/drug assessment and complete recommended treatment-responsible for finding the funding for any treatment/counseling recommended.
The Def is to obtain counseling as directed by DOC at the expense of the Def.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

supervisions.notes:
Defendant is granted credit for time served as calculated by the Ashland County Sheriff's Department
Report to Jail immediately 
Granted Work Release 
Granted Good Time

Notice to Def-installation of ignition interlock device, cost reduction on IID, and links to Information on DMV website.
Mandatory interlock for all alcohol concentration-License restricted to interlocked vehicles, plus all registered and titled vehicles (unless exempted) for a period of no less than one year BEGINNING when the license is issued.
Undergo alcohol/drug assessment and complete recommended treatment-responsible for finding the funding for any treatment/counseling recommended.
The Def is to provide a DNA specimen to the Ashland County Jail.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt:
Defendant David M Oksa in court with attorney Joseph E Martell.  Ruth Diane Kressel appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 16CM123 and 16TR764, agreement reached. ADA agreement reached as detailed in offer to settle. Parties state that is the agreement. Plea NC to cts 3 and 4. Admits 3rd conviction in ct 4. Admits .281.  Ct accepts plea finds def Guilty.  Atty Martell comments on sentencing, request treatment time be given credit toward jail time. Def comments on sentencing. Ct will grant credit time served for time def was in treatment.
Sentencing see attachment.  Days to pay scheduled for October 15, 2016 at 08:00 am.

Attorney Joseph E Martell in court.  Ruth Diane Kressel appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Atty Martell, client in treatment, offer rec today, request adj  Status conference scheduled for August 15, 2016 at 01:45 pm.

Attorney Joseph E Martell in court.  Ruth Diane Kressel appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Auth filed, def has not rec compl yet. Stands Mute. Bond continues  Status conference scheduled for July 18, 2016 at 01:45 pm.
